Comment:
Hi everyone!

Many years ago I played an OTB game for Cambridge City Chess Club against Brandon, King's Gambit Chess Club.  It was a home match.  I had played Kevin in a few previous matches, one where I was in an ending of opposite colour bishops and I lost because I overlooked a removal of the guard combo, another where I learned my lesson and did not fall for that trick twice and went on to draw.  Here the opposite bishop scenario did not occur and the position appeared to be even right to the endgame where he made one slip up and it cost him dear.  Here is how it all happened ....
1. ..... d5 - it all started with the Scandinavian (Centre Counter) Defense which is quite playable although the Wicked Witch of the West can get chased around quite a bit!
3. Nc3 - Like this.
3. Nc3 - Like this.
3. Nc3 - Like this.
5. Bd2 - Fou Lenoir prepares a fairly standard battery against the Witch.
5. Bd2 - Fou Lenoir prepares a fairly standard battery against the Witch.
5. Bd2 - Fou Lenoir prepares a fairly standard battery against the Witch.
5. Bd2 - Fou Lenoir prepares a fairly standard battery against the Witch.
6. Nf3 - development.
6. Nf3 - development.
7. Be2 - development and pin-breaker.
7. Be2 - development and pin-breaker.
8. Ne4 - battery unmasked and hoping for NxN, BxQ - but Kevin does not fall for it.
8. Ne4 - battery unmasked and hoping for NxN, BxQ - but Kevin does not fall for it.
9. ..... Nxf6 - knight trade.
9. ..... Nxf6 - knight trade.
9. ..... Nxf6 - knight trade.
11. Qxe2 - bishop trade.
11. Qxe2 - bishop trade.
11. Qxe2 - bishop trade.
13. Bf4 - a lotta tension along the h2-b8 diagonal.

18. Qb3 - 18 moves and I still haven't castled and the queens are on the board, tut, tut Jo!  Mind you - the BK did not castle until move 13 and Henry seems safe enough.  However, I make my final decision of where I want Henry to be next move.

19. 0-0-0 - Queenside.
19. 0-0-0 - Queenside.
22. Qc2 - this move appears to lose a pawn but it does not as you will soon see.
22. Qc2 - this move appears to lose a pawn but it does not as you will soon see.

23. Nxe4 - the f pawn is traded for black's e pawn.  This knight move also defends the pawn on g3 and the pawn on g2 is defended X-ray fashion by Glenda!  So this puts the question to the Wicked Witch of the West.  Trade herself off for Glenda or get out of my pos!

24. Kxc2 - Kevin trades her off and this trade helps me because it brings Henry closer to the centre for the endgame.
24. Kxc2 - Kevin trades her off and this trade helps me because it brings Henry closer to the centre for the endgame.
26. Rde1 - Because the rook on f8 is momentarily tied to defending the f7 pawn I decided to bag the open e file with my rook.
